sn35.65:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
sn35.65:4.2: Then Venerable Samiddhi went up to the Buddha …
sn35.65:4.4: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘Māra’.
sn35.65:4.5: How do we define Māra or what is known as Māra?”
sn35.65:5.1: “Samiddhi, where there is the eye, sights, eye consciousness, and phenomena cognizable by eye consciousness, there is Māra or what is known as Māra.
sn35.65:5.2: Where there is the ear, sounds, ear consciousness, and phenomena cognizable by ear consciousness, there is Māra or what is known as Māra.
sn35.65:5.3: Where there is the nose, smells, nose consciousness, and phenomena cognizable by nose consciousness, there is Māra or what is known as Māra.
sn35.65:5.4: Where there is the tongue, tastes, tongue consciousness, and phenomena cognizable by tongue consciousness, there is Māra or what is known as Māra.
sn35.65:5.5: Where there is the body, touches, body consciousness, and phenomena cognizable by body consciousness, there is Māra or what is known as Māra.
sn35.65:5.6: Where there is the mind, phenomena, mind consciousness, and phenomena cognizable by mind consciousness, there is Māra or what is known as Māra.
sn35.65:6.1: Where there is no eye, no sights, no eye consciousness, and no phenomena cognizable by eye consciousness, there is no Māra or what is known as Māra.
sn35.65:6.6: Where there is no mind, no phenomena, no mind consciousness, and no phenomena cognizable by mind consciousness, there is no Māra or what is known as Māra.”
